p: There is now evidence that sylvatic cycles in Southeast Asia also occur on islands within the region. In Sri Lanka, almost all the NHPs studied in Polonnaruwa in 1987 had neutralising antibody to DENV-2 (Table 2) [ 56]. Further analysis revealed a highly focal epizootic of DENV had occurred in the population (Table 2) [ 57], which was not associated with a concurrent human outbreak. On the island of Borneo (Malaysia), nearly a third of wild and semi-captive orangutans ( Pongo pygmaeus) sampled were seropositive to DENV-2 (Table 2) [ 58] and a few captive cynomolgus ( Macaca fascicularis) on the nearby Luzon Island in the Philippines were IgM positive to DENV and all of them were IgG positive by ELISA against one or more flaviviruses (JEV and/or DENV) (Table 2) [ 59] suggesting a subacute primary infection or a reinfection.
